remarks: Closure of a finite group sum.  This theorem has a weaker hypothesis than ~ gsumcl , because it is not required that ` F ` is a function (actually, the hypothesis always holds for any proper class ` F ` ). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Dec-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)  (Revised by AV, 3-Jun-2019.)
statement:
gsumcl.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsumcl.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsumcl.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsumcl.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsumcl.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
gsumcl2.w $e |- ( ph -> ( F supp .0. ) e. Fin ) $.
gsumcl2 $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) e. B ) $.
